alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Lewis and Clark; Teton (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 29 at 6:15PM MDT until August 29 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Lewis and Clark County in west central Montana... South central Teton County in north central Montana... Northwestern Cascade County in central Montana... * Until 700 PM MDT. * At 615 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 15 miles southwest of Augusta to 10 miles north of Wolf Creek, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. Hail up to one half inch in diameter. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Fairfield, Augusta, Fort Shaw, Fort Shaw, Bowmans Corner, Pishkun Reservoir, Nilan Reservoir, Bean Lake, Simms, and Sun River. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
